conclusion: Analyze forces and induced EMF on rods to determine speed of rod b
Calculate induced EMF in rod a using formula E = B L v_a
Values: B = 0.2 T, L = 0.5 m, v_a = 1.0 m/s
Substitute values to find E = 0.1 V
Calculate total resistance R_total = R_a + R_b
Resistances: R_a = 0.1 Ω, R_b = 0.1 Ω
Find R_total = 0.2 Ω
Use Ohm's Law to find current I = E / R_total
Calculate I = 0.5 A
Calculate magnetic force on rod a: F_a = B I L
Find F_a = 0.05 N
Calculate net force on rod a: F_net,a = F - F_a - m_a g sin θ
Values: F = 2 N, m_a = 0.3 kg, g = 10 m/s², θ = 30°
Calculate gravitational component: m_a g sin θ = 1.5 N
Find F_net,a = 0.45 N
Use Newton's second law to find acceleration a_a = F_net,a / m_a
Calculate a_a = 1.5 m/s²
Current in rod b is same as in rod a: 0.5 A
Calculate magnetic force on rod b: F_b = B I L
Find F_b = 0.05 N
Calculate net force on rod b: F_net,b = F_b - m_b g sin θ
Value: m_b = 0.1 kg
Calculate gravitational component: m_b g sin θ = 0.5 N
